lesson.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a period of time in which someone is taught a particular skill, for example how to play a musical instrument or drive a car
lesson.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a period of time in which school students are taught a particular subject
lesson.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I’ve got a double maths lesson next.
Andrew gives private lessons in Spanish.
lesson.translation[0].definitions[2].def: something that provides experience or information that you can learn from and use
lesson.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Now let that be a lesson to you all  (=be careful to avoid having the same bad experience again).
Her fate should be a salutary lesson  (=one that teaches or warns you about something).
There were important lessons to be learned from these discoveries.
The government has failed to learn the lessons of history.
The men’s courage and faith is a lesson to us all.
lesson.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a part of a book that is used for learning a particular subject, especially in school
lesson.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a short piece that is read from the Bible during a religious ceremony
lesson.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He started taking piano lessons at age four.
I have swimming lessons on Friday.
I have to go to my French lesson now.
She made a living giving private lessons in English.
The teachers spend a long time preparing their lessons.
I've got a history lesson this afternoon.
Dad said he'd pay for driving lessons as my birthday present.
I'd just started classical guitar lessons.
He gave private lessons in mathematics at the weekends.
